data.title: Abbeys Castles and Ancient Halls by John Timbs
data.meta_description: Abbeys, Castles and Ancient Halls of England and Wales : North and Wales by John Timbs & Alexander Gunn and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Condition: Good. 571 pages. No dust jacket. Red cloth with gilt lettering. Pages are lightly tanned and thumbed at the edges, with light foxing. Binding has remained firm. Boards are a little rub worn, slight shelf wear to corners, spine and edges. Corners are a little bumped. Spine ends are mildly crushed. Tanning to spine and edges. Boards are bowed. Book has a forward lean. Water marks to boards and spine.

Hardcover. Condition: Fair. Dust Jacket Condition: Fair. Dust jacket rather tatty around the edges, rather tanned and foxed. There is also some tanning and foxing to the pages and an inscription inside.

Hardback. Vol II, Midland. Handsomely bound in red cloth with bright gilt pictorial to the front and gilt titles to the spine. The binding is in good condition despite a little fading to the spine. The pages within are very lightly toned although clean throughout, illustrated with the occasional black and white photographic plate. pp. x 576. Overall a good copy.nbsp; book.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Frederick Warne & Co. Ltd., London no date but circa 1930,s gilt titles on spine, red boards, 573pp. Frontis, 9 b/w plates.small stain to front board, chlids name to fep and some light foxing but still in good tight clean reading order. Full refund if not satisfied. 24 hour despatch. If not pictured in this listing, a scan of the actual book is available on request.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Reprint. Undated early reprint, 12mo, 590pp, line frontis, green blind decorated cloth lettered gilt to spine; some rubbing and minor wear to extrems and spine lettering, the solitary number 6 adorns the corner of the ffep, but by and large this is a clean example, certainly VG Copy, probably 1900-1920. There are 3 volumes in this series of which this is the first Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Pocket Edition. Red boards bumped corners, slight fading to spine. Contents clean and firm, slightly aged with small brown spots to text block edges and a few internally 577 pps. . Covid 19 - Please see "More Information" for current shipping terms.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Some wear to covers and spine, mainly edges and corners, corners a little bumped, top and bottom of spine a little bumped, small rip at top of spine 1.5cm, internally in good condition, pages crisp and clear.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Undated but insc at top of fep for 1895. Not a first as contents page lists 'new' properties (14) with an asterisk. Red boards damp affected along leading edges at front and rear, spine edns turn and edges rubbed. Brown paper eps. One plate loose otherwise clean and firm copy. Covid 19 - Please see "More Information" for current shipping terms.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. No Jacket. volume 2 only. shelf wear on the boards, the rear one is a bit marked. gold gilt on the top edge. mild foxing. gift inscription. binding is intact and all pages are clear and legible. undated, C. 1908. may require extra postage. [SK]. Our orders are shipped using tracked courier delivery services.

Abbeys, Castles & Ancient Halls of England & Wales - vol 2

Timbs, John

Published by Published by Frederick Warne, London, nd (c1870) Volume two only (2 stars on spine) of a 3 volume set.Green cloth boards, gilt lettering to spine. Blind stamped decoration to front and rear boards. Blind stamped lettering in circular format to front board, no dustwrapper. 7ins x 5ins, xii, 580pp, 16pp book adverts plus frontis with five vignette illustrations. Counties covered are Essex, Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire, Oxfordshire, Glouctershire, Monmouthshire, Somersetshire, Wiltshire, Berkshire, Surrey, Kent, Sussex, Hampshire, Dorset, Devonshire, Cornwall, Channel Islands, Isle of Man, North Wales and South Wales. Front hinge cracked but holding. G+ nr VG.,

Seller: Missing Books (PBFA), Great Leighs, United Kingdom

Association Member: PBFA

Seller Rating:

Contact seller

Hardcover. Condition: Good. No Jacket. Due to age and/or environmental conditions, the pages of this book have darkened. Boards are moderate to severely edgeworn. Binding is very loose. Some pages are falling out. Please note the image in this listing is a stock photo and may not match the covers of the actual item. Book.
